alert.note: Alert for Harris; Meriwether; Talbot; Troup; Upson (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 12 at 10:48AM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Meriwether, west central Upson, southeastern Troup, northwestern Talbot and northeastern Harris Counties through 1115 AM EDT... At 1048 AM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was near Stovall, or 10 miles north of Hamilton, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...40 to 50 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Hamilton, Manchester, Pine Mountain, Woodbury, Warm Springs, Woodland, Pine Mountain-Callaway Gardens, Shiloh, F.d. Roosevelt State Park, Raleigh, Flint Hill, Odessadale, Sprewell Bluff State Park, Stovall, Big Springs, Durand, Harris City and Pine Mountain Valley. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.
